subject: Re: Pro x pedals
description_text:
I updated Simsonn manager to the latest and it will now recognize in
Iracing and everything appears ok except the throttle.   It only registers
about 25% for the first 75% of travel and then 75% for the last 25%
travel.  I have it set to straight curve.

My haptics at times will stay in the vibrating position until I restart my
computer.  I have the controller box grounded to the pedals and PC.  I had
this issue with my old base as well.

Brian Pinnow
608 769 8354


On Fri, Nov 21, 2025 at 9:21 PM Brian Pinnow <brijeninvest@gmail.com> wrote:

> Hello
> I just installed a simagic evo pro and now Iracing won’t recognize my
> Simsonn pro x pedals.  The base and pedals are not connected in anyway but
> that’s all that changed.   I had a moza base.
>
> The pedals will sometimes be recognized in Simsonn manager but when they
> are they are glitchy.  In have the control grounded to the pedals.  I
> removed that but it’s not any different.
>
> I just don’t know what could cause it.
>
>
> Brian Pinnow
> 608 769 8354
>

conversations.body_text: Hi Brian Pinnow,    Please make sure you are using SIMSONN Manager 2.1.2 with firmware versions: CPU1: 2.0.5 CPU2: 2.0.4  Then click the Offset button in the software to zero the pedal signals, and recalibrate the pedals.

How do I check the CPU1 and 2?

Also my haptics run in either a very high frequency or low power in Iracing
thru simhub.  When tested in simhub they feel fine though.

I still have issues with the haptics locking on even with the controller
grounded.
Brian Pinnow
608 769 8354


On Mon, Nov 24, 2025 at 1:55 AM support@simsonn.com
Hi Brian Pinnow,

That is what I’m running.  How do I setup a return for these?  I’m tired of
the constant problems with connection.  I have tried grounding even though
my pro x ultra controls box doesn’t even have a grounding screw.

Brian Pinnow
608 769 8354


On Wed, Nov 26, 2025 at 5:48 AM support@simsonn.com

Hi Brian Pinnow, If this happens, it indicates that the computer’s grounding is not reliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used with a three-prong wall outlet. You can refer to the post below: connect the computer case to the stand, and connect the control box to the metal screws on the pedals. This should resolve the disconnection issue.     https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding

I have done this already.

Brian Pinnow
608 769 8354


On Wed, Nov 26, 2025 at 6:09 AM support@simsonn.com

Hi Brian Pinnow,    Could you take a photo of the ground connection between your PC case, main control box, and pedals? I can help you check it. If the pedals get stuck, it’s usually caused by an unreliable ground connection.  You can download the VKB tool to test—it displays the pedal curves. Continuously press the pedals for 1–3 minutes; if the pedals get stuck, the curve will suddenly become a straight line. This helps determine whether the grounding issue is resolved.  If it turns out to be a problem with the main control box, we will replace it with a new one. However, in most cases, the issue is due to poor grounding.       https://www.vkbcontrollers.com/pages/downloads

I have already sent this
I have attached again.  I also tried from my wheel base to the computer.
Again I don’t have a grounding location on my control box


Brian Pinnow

608 769 8354


On Wed, Nov 26, 2025 at 6:19 AM support@simsonn.com

Hi Brian Pinnow,        I’ve seen your connection setup, and overall it is correct, but some optimizations can be made:    Connect one screw on the PC case to the right side of the pedal, and the left screw of the pedal to the control box. This will solve the issue of the control box lacking a screw mounting point.    Also, the cables seem thick and hard to secure. Simply remove some of the black paint or oxidation layer so that the PC case, pedal, and control box share a common ground, which should resolve the problem.

I have them on both sides of the control box already.  I’m not sure what
would be different with your way?


Brian Pinnow
608 769 8354


On Wed, Nov 26, 2025 at 6:39 AM support@simsonn.com

Hi Brian Pinnow,  I see that the grounding is fine. The pedals are working properly in SIMSONN Manager 2.1.2 and in the game, but occasionally there’s a disconnection that causes the motor to keep vibrating, correct?

Correct.  They typically get disconnected when one motor is vibrating for a
longer period of time.  Also if operated in simhub they have a high pitch
and low force to them.   They seem fine when operated in Simsonn.  When I
do a test in simhub they are fine but not in the game.

Brian Pinnow
608 769 8354


On Sun, Nov 30, 2025 at 8:40 PM support@simsonn.com

And now my brake motor has lost almost all strength.  Other motors seem
normal and I have not changed settings.  I tried changing them to get more
strength and it won’t get as strong as others or what it was.

Brian Pinnow
608 769 8354
Hi Brian Pinnow,    Do you need us to send a new VAM Pro to resolve the issue? Please provide your order number, contact name, phone number, and shipping address.

We can try that, attached is the amazon purchase.

Brian Pinnow
N7169 Bice Ave
Holmen, WI 54636

Also I still have the issue of only high pitch sounds and no feedback when
using simhub.  I try all the strength and frequency settings and nothing
changes.  When I do the "test" in simhub they are fine, but just high pitch
noise in Iracing.  If I use Simsonn manager, they are fine.

Brian Pinnow
769-8354


On Mon, Dec 8, 2025 at 4:27 AM support@simsonn.com

What about the high pitch from simhub?  I even reinstall simhub.

Brian Pinnow
608 769 8354


On Wed, Dec 10, 2025 at 12:34 AM support@simsonn.com

I just noticed the power supply that was provided does not have a ground.
Why would that be?  Is it supposed too?


Brian Pinnow
608 769 8354

Hi Brian Pinnow,  This 24V power supply does not require a ground connection. If SimHub is not working properly, please let me know which game and which telemetry it concerns, so I can test it on my side. Additionally, do you need me to send a new control box or a VAM motor?

It’s in Iracing.  In don’t know why simhub is all high pitch and Simsonn
manager works fine.

We can try a new control box.  I’m at a loss at how to get them to not
constantly disconnect, I have tried all your grounding suggestions and sent
pictures and you confirmed.

Brian Pinnow
608 769 8354


On Sat, Dec 13, 2025 at 9:44 PM support@simsonn.com

Hi Brian Pinnow,  You can adjust the offset in the software, which will shift all pedals’ white signals close to 0%, and then recalibrate the pedals. Also, for the interference issue, please refer to the link below.      If this happens, it indicates that the computer’s grounding is not reliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used with a three-prong wall outlet. You can refer to the post below: connect the computer case to the stand, and connect the control box to the metal screws on the pedals. This should resolve the disconnection issue.  https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding
